description: From Latin cōgēns, present active participle of cōgō (“drive together, compel”), from cō + agō (“drive”).

adjectives.description: cogent (comparative more cogent, superlative most cogent)

entries.meaning: Reasonable and convincing; based on evidence.
Appealing to the intellect or powers of reasoning.

examples: The prosecution presented a cogent argument, convincing the jury of the defendant's guilt.
